title: Choosing Database Mode
content:
## What is Database Mode?

Database mode determines where your settings and projector configurations are stored.

## Two Options

### Standalone (SQLite) - Recommended for Most Users

**Best for:**
- Individual users
- Single computer installations
- No central server available

**Characteristics:**
- Settings stored locally: `%APPDATA%\ProjectorControl\`
- No network database required
- Easy setup and maintenance
- Data stays on your computer only

### Enterprise (SQL Server) - For Organizations

**Best for:**
- Organizations with multiple computers
- Shared configuration across users
- Centralized management

**Requirements:**
- SQL Server instance (setup by IT)
- Server hostname/IP address
- Database credentials
- Network connectivity to server

**Benefits:**
- Multiple computers share same projector list
- Centralized configuration management
- IT can manage remotely

## Making Your Choice

**Not sure?** Select **Standalone (SQLite)**
- Works for 95% of users
- You can migrate to Enterprise later if needed
- Contact IT to assist with migration

## After Setup

> **Note:** Database mode cannot be changed after initial setup without reinstalling. Choose carefully!

> **Tip:** If your organization has a SQL Server, check with IT before choosing. They may want you to use Enterprise mode.
